results.title: Left stellate stimulation: regional myocardial flows and ischemic injury in dogs.
results.text_hl: In @DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@ischemic myocardium@@@ LSGS did not change RMBF but increased S-T segment. However, after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, LSGS increased @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ RMBF and the @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@-to-nonischemic areas flow ratio (reverse @<m>DISEASE_Subclavian_Steal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013349 @@@coronary steal phenomenon@@@), these effects being abolished by @CHEMICAL_Phenoxybenzamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010643 @@@phenoxybenzamine@@@.

citations.NLM: Giudicelli JF, Berdeaux A, Tato F, Garnier M. Left stellate stimulation: regional myocardial flows and ischemic injury in dogs. Am J Physiol. 1980 Sep;239(3):H359-64. PMID: 6254372
